description: Installation of 1 digital illuminated advertisement display within proposed new communications kiosk.
subdivision_of_building: Installation of a new communication kiosk on the same site
decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The development shall be carried out in accordance with the reports, specifications and drawings detailed [Location Plan; Site Plan; NWP-KIOSK/001; NEW COMMUNICATIONS KIOSK_ OVERVIEW and SPECIFICATION (Document Dated August 2024)]. 
Reason: To ensure a satisfactory standard of development and to allow the local planning authority to review any potential changes to the scheme. 
Condition : 2 - The maximum steady brightness of the advertisement hereby permitted is not to exceed 300 candelas per sq.m.
Reason: To ensure the sign does not have an adverse effect on the amenity of the area in accordance with Council policy LP9 of the Local Plan and to comply with paragraph 141 of the National Planning Policy Framework. 
Condition : 3 - The advertisements must be static and contain no moving features, flashing, 
animation, intermittent light source or exposed cold cathode tubing. Sequential advertisements displayed via the unit permitted by this consent shall not change more than once every 10 seconds. The interval between successive displays shall take place over a period no greater than one second; the complete screen shall change with no visual effects (including fading, swiping or other animated transition methods) between displays and the display will include a mechanism to freeze the image in the event of a malfunction.
Reason: In the interest of highway safety and of the visual amenities of the 
locality in accordance with Council policy LP9 of the Local Plan and to comply with the National Planning Policy Framework.
Condition : 4 - No music or sound shall be emitted from the advertisements.
Reason: In the interest of the aural amenities of the locality in accordance with Council Policy LP2 and LP9 of the Local Plan.
Condition : 5 - INFORMATIVE: In dealing with this application the Council has implemented the requirement in the National Planning Policy Framework to work with the applicant in a positive and proactive manner and the Council has, as far as practicable, sought solutions to problems arising in relation to dealing with the planning application. The Council has made available detailed advice in the form of its statutory policies in the Local Plan (2023) as well as offering a full pre-application advice service, in order to ensure that the applicant has been given every opportunity to submit an application which is likely to be considered favourably. In addition, where appropriate, further guidance was offered to the applicant during the processing of the application.
